intro: Sericocoma quadrangula, commonly known as the four-angled sericocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its stems are distinctly four-angled, giving it a unique and rugged appearance. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a cluster, making it a notable species in its native habitat.
